questions: Tooth enamel is the hardest substance in our body. Name the compound of which it is made up of. At what pH of the mouth it gets corroded ? State the role of bacteria present in the mouth. Suggest a method to prevent tooth decay.
answers: Tooth enamel is made up of compound calcium phosphate. Its pH is 5.5. Bacteria present in the mouth works on the leftover food particles and produce acid. Tooth pastes are used for neutralising the excess acid.

questions: A yellow powder ‘A’ gives a pungent smell when left in open. It is a good oxidising agent and is used for bleaching cotton linen in textile industries. Identify A and give its method of preparation. What is its commercial name ?
answers: The given compound ‘A’ is calcium oxychloride because it is a oxidising agent and in open it reacts with CO2 to give pungent smell of chlorine gas. CaOCl2 + CO2 → CaCO3 + Cl2 It is prepared by the action of dry slaked lime with chlorine gas. Ca2 + Cl2 → CaOCl2 + H2O Calcium oxychloride is commercially known as Bleaching powder.

questions: You are provided with three test tubes A, B and C which contain distilled water, acidic solution and basic solution respectively. If you are given blue litmus paper only, how will you identify the contents of each test tube ?
answers: Put blue litmus paper in all the three test tubes. In one test tube it will turn red that is acid. Now Put red Litmus paper in other two test tubes. The one which turn blue is base and the third one is distilled water, as it turned paper neither red nor blue.

questions: A compound ‘P’ forms the enamel of teeth. It is the hardest substance of the body. It doesn’t dissolve in water but gets corroded when the pH is lowered below 5.5.  Identify the compound ‘P’.  How does it undergo damage due to eating of chocolate and sweets ? What should we do to prevent tooth decay ?  3
answers: The compound ‘P’ is calcium phosphate.  It undergoes damage when the bacteria present in the mouth work on the left over food particles and produce acid. To prevent tooth decay, toothpastes  are used which neutralises the excess acid.

answers: Acidic — Solution A Basic — Solution B 		 Solution A because H+ ion concentration is higher in acidic solutions.  When same concentration of HCl and acetic acid are taken , then these produce different amounts of H+ ion . HCl gives more H+ but acetic acid gives less H+ ions .
